an6.24:4.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant who has six qualities could split apart Himalaya, the king of mountains. How much more so this wretched ignorance!
an6.24:4.3: It’s when a mendicant is skilled in entering samādhi, skilled in remaining in samādhi, skilled in emerging from samādhi, skilled in gladdening the mind for samādhi, skilled in the meditation subjects for samādhi, and skilled in directing the mind purified by samādhi.
an6.24:4.4: A mendicant who has these six qualities could split apart Himalaya, the king of mountains. How much more so this wretched ignorance!”
